Posts.Content: Hi @Boobylou  I had most of my treatment at Wigan but had my radiotherapy at Aintree. Liverpool or Manchester would both suit me for a meet up. Paula
Posts.Title: meet up

Posts.Content: @Maria W. I am also 55 grade 2 and stage 1. I had a lumpectony and started radiotherapy last week. So far i have had no side effects whatsoever and have carried on working and even if a did i would still choose to have the treatment. For me its not worth the risk not to have it.
Posts.Title: Anyone refused radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Frillyflower I havent posted for a while but today is 6 months since my diagnosis. My lump was found on mammogram, 1.5cm (originslly they said 1.7). I had lumpectomy and then radiotherapy and im on Tamoxifen for 5 years. Confirmed as stage 1A I too am an academic and had just had a promotion. I worked throughout (had surgery over Christmas hols) and had no time off sick. I was lucky as i had no side effects at all from treatment and colleagues were great (I told them as soon as family knew).  Im so glad i carried on working as it was a distraction whilst waiting for results after surgery and also helped maintain ‘normality’.  I am now getting on with life although on days like today i think ‘ did that really happen to me?’.  Good luck with your treatment and recovery. Paula
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Good luck tomorrow Jac. Had a great weekend of walking butnerd to up the miles as im doing the Edinburgh Moonwalk with a friend in June.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Rockchic67 I too am awaiting results (19th Jan) of WLE and SNB and if i have node involvement im going to ask about this trial (link below) which starts on the 16th Jan. Its worth a look !! A trial looking at a test to predict who might benefit from chemotherapy for breast cancer (OPTIMA) http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/find-a-clinical-trial/a-trial-looking-predict-when-chemotherapy-needed-breast-cancer-optima#undefined
Posts.Title: not the news I wanted today!!

Posts.Content: Jac/ladies I am also starting radiotherapy on Wednesday. Ive been out and bought Aloe Vera cream as advised by many of the ladies on here. My appointments are all at 1.30 and my employers have agreed to me working flexibly so im hoping for minimul side affects but who knows. Just want to get this part of the treatment over with. Feeling a bit apprehensive. Good luck with your rads Paula
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Jac day 7 for me so half way already. All going really well so far, skin fine and no fatique yet. I go during lunch at work so its a bit rushed but theres a great coffee shop in the radiotherapy centre that does lovely fruit cske. Doing lots of walking in the evening with hubby, eating healthy and drinking loads of water. Fingers crossed that we all sail through this. Paula
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Yes i certainly will be celebrating if all goes well. Good luck with everything. Nearly there x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Well thats good news Jac. Lets get this over with !! Hope you’re having a lovely evening. Champers? Nice x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: @louis7 im glad you bought this up as all the advice ive read says to avoid having a bath. Im trying to carry on working through radiotherapy but love a good soak at the end of the day.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Jac, Im having 15. Start on Valentines day and finish on birthday we seem to be on the same path st present as i slso started Tamoxifen 3 weeks ago !! Paula
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: So first zap for me today and it all went very smoothly so back at work within an hour. I did however ask whether it was ok to use 99.9% Aloe Vera as recommended by many on this forum. The radiographer told me thst it contained ‘metal particles’ and shouldnt be used but it was my choice. This threw me slightly as have never heard that one before. Any one else been advised against using Aloe Vera ??
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Oh no Jacmatholmad that sucks.How frustrating for you. Hopefully you wont have to wait too much longer.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: @Ginacarla i had numbness around the lumpectomy site and armpit where they did the lymph node biopsy back in December. The sensation is just coming back. Its early days so i wouldnt worry about it right now.

Posts.Content: Gilly ive subscribed to the free videos and when ive had chance to look at them will make a decision as to whether want to pay for the course. I’ll also see if i can find any reviews and also check out her credentials !
